text:

Opinions expressed are solely my own and do not express the views of my employer or any organizations I am associated with.

In short, you may share and adapt this content with appropriate credit and notation of any changes. You may not use this material for any commercial purposes.

title: Jadey Ryan
text:
Hi there! 

Thanks for visiting my website – I’m happy you’re here!
I started a small business to tap into my creativity and combine two of my favorite things: cats and code. I create designs that embody the general theme of cats, programming, and data science. Check out my shop the coding cats!
In my day job, I work as a data scientist for the Natural Resources and Agricultural Sciences section within the Washington State Department of Agriculture. I have a background in natural sciences (BS in Biology, BA in Environmental Studies, and MS in Land Resources & Environmental Sciences). My R programming skills were self/community taught in an effort to improve efficiency, accuracy, and reproducibility in data analyses and visualizations.
The core values I live by are kindness, authenticity, sustainability, and inclusivity. I feel particularly fulfilled working in the environmental data science space and meeting so many amazing folks in the R and open-source community.
I am happiest when hanging out with my husband and three snowshoe siamese cats, trying new foods, playing in the beautiful outdoors, automating tedious tasks, and developing data driven decision-support tools.

title: Accessibility commitment
text:
Making sure all content I publish on the web is accessible to anyone and everyone is very important to me. While I’m not an expert on web design or accessibility, I am committed to trying my best.
This accessibility commitment was adapted from Silvia Canelón’s excellent blog.

title: Accessibility commitment
text:
Feedback
I welcome any feedback on the accessibility and inclusivity of my site and content. Please let me know if you encounter any accessibility barriers or areas for improvement and I’ll do my best to remedy them.

title: Accessibility commitment
text:
Accessibility practices
This site has been designed with the following features in mind:

A color palette that meets WCAG 2.1 AA standards for contrast.
Alternative text for all informative images.
Readable font faces, specifically to avoid impostor letter shapes and mirroring.

1iIl should all look different from one another.
This site primarily uses Merriweather for headings, Atkinson Hyperlegible for body text (developed by the Braille Institute), and Fira Code for code.

A table of contents in the sidebars for easier navigation.

title: Accessibility commitment
text:
